Class Sprite

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jlreyes.libraries.android_game_engine.sprites.Sprite
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GameCamera, RectSprite, SpriteWrapper

    public abstract class Sprite
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Sprite(java.lang.String name, Layer layer, Renderable renderable, TexController.TexInfo texInfo, boolean isMoveable)
      Same as Sprite(String, Layer, Renderable, int, boolean, float, float, float, float) except this creates a sprite with default position, scale, and angle.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Sprite

        public Sprite(java.lang.String name,
      SpriteWrapper spriteWrapper,
      Renderable renderable,
      TexController.TexInfo texInfo,
      boolean isMoveable)
        Same as Sprite(String, SpriteWrapper, Renderable, int, boolean, float, float, float, float) except this creates a sprite with default position, scale, and angle.

      • Sprite

        public Sprite(java.lang.String name,
      SpriteWrapper wrapper,
      Renderable renderable,
      TexController.TexInfo texInfo,
      boolean isMovable,
      float startX,
      float startY,
      float startScale,
      float startAngle)
        Creates a new sprite.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the sprite.
        wrapper - The spritewrapper holding this sprite.
        renderable - The renderable to use for this sprite
        texInfo - The texture to load and use for this sprite.
        isMovable - True iff this sprite will ever move from its starting position, scale, or angle
        startX - The starting x position for this sprite.
        startY - The starting y position for this sprite.
        startScale - The starting scale for this sprite
        startAngle - The starting angle for this sprite

      • Sprite

      SpriteWrapper spriteWrapper,
      Renderable renderable,
      Texture texture,
      boolean isMoveable)
        Same as Sprite(String, SpriteWrapper, Renderable, Texture, boolean, float, float, float, float) except this creates a sprite with default position, scale, and angle.

      • Sprite

        public Sprite(java.lang.String name,
      SpriteWrapper wrapper,
      Renderable renderable,
      Texture texture,
      boolean isMoveable,
      float startX,
      float startY,
      float startScale,
      float startAngle)
        Creates a new sprite.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the sprite.
        wrapper - The spritewrapper holding this sprite.
        renderable - The renderable to use for this sprite
        texture - The already loaded texture to use for this sprite.
        isMoveable - True iff this sprite will ever move from its starting position, scale, or angle
        startX - The starting x position for this sprite.
        startY - The starting y position for this sprite.
        startScale - The starting scale for this sprite
        startAngle - The starting angle for this sprite

      Renderable renderable,
      Texture texture,
      boolean isMoveable)
        Same as Sprite(String, Layer, Renderable, Texture, boolean, float, float, float, float) except this creates a sprite with default position, scale, and angle.

      • Sprite

        public Sprite(java.lang.String name,
      Layer layer,
      Renderable renderable,
      Texture texture,
      boolean isMoveable,
      float startX,
      float startY,
      float startScale,
      float startAngle)
        Creates a new sprite.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the sprite.
        layer - The layer this sprite is attached to.
        renderable - The renderable to use for this sprite
        texture - The already loaded texture to use for this sprite.
        isMoveable - True iff this sprite will ever move from its starting position, scale, or angle
        startX - The starting x position for this sprite.
        startY - The starting y position for this sprite.
        startScale - The starting scale for this sprite
        startAngle - The starting angle for this sprite

      TexController.TexInfo texInfo,
      boolean isMoveable)
        Same as Sprite(String, Layer, Renderable, int, boolean, float, float, float, float) except this creates a sprite with default position, scale, and angle.

      • Sprite

        public Sprite(java.lang.String name,
      Layer layer,
      Renderable renderable,
      TexController.TexInfo texInfo,
      boolean isMoveable,
      float startX,
      float startY,
      float startScale,
      float startAngle)
        Creates a new sprite.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the sprite.
        layer - The layer this sprite is attached to.
        renderable - The renderable to use for this sprite
        texInfo - The texture to load and use for this sprite.
        isMoveable - True iff this sprite will ever move from its starting position, scale, or angle
        startX - The starting x position for this sprite.
        startY - The starting y position for this sprite.
        startScale - The starting scale for this sprite
        startAngle - The starting angle for this sprite

    • Method Detail

      • onStartLogicStep

        public void onStartLogicStep()
        Grabs a free renderable for the logic step. MUST BE CALLED AT THE BEGINNING OF EVERY LOGIC STEP.

      • update

        public abstract void update(long deltaTime)
        Step this character by deltaTime.

      • onEndLogicStep

        public Renderable onEndLogicStep(java.lang.Thread thread)
        MUST BE CALLED AT END OF EVERY LOGIC STEP. Updates the active renderable and then sets it to null.
        Returns:
        The renderable passed.

      • getActiveRenderable

        public Renderable getActiveRenderable()
        Returns the active renderable.

      • changeRenderable

        public void changeRenderable(Renderable renderable)
        Changes this sprites renderable to the given renderable.

      • setTextureState

        public void setTextureState(TexController.TexStateInfo stateInfo)

      • release

        public void release(java.lang.Thread thread)
        If the given thread holds a renderable for this sprite, calling this releases it

      • isTouching

        public abstract boolean isTouching(float x,
                 float y)
        Returns true iff the given x and y touch the sprite.

      • onTouchDown

        public abstract boolean onTouchDown(android.view.MotionEvent e)
        Called when a touch starts on the sprite.
        Returns:
        true if this sprite handled the touch, false otherwise.

      • onTouchCancel

        public abstract void onTouchCancel(android.view.MotionEvent e)
        Called when a touch is canceled after a onTouchDown was called.

      • onTouchUp

        public abstract boolean onTouchUp(android.view.MotionEvent e)
        Called when a touch ends on the sprite.
        Returns:
        true if this sprite handled the touch, false otherwise.
